Expected Behavior:
Slide show should display

Actual Behavior:
Site doesn't load

This is a bug from Bugzilla that is not Mozilla specific, fails in Firefox/Chrome/IE/Safari. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=876228

Error console shows:
Error: TypeError: slides[i].setUserData is not a function
Source file: http://www.owlfolio.org/media/2010/05/stegotorus-talk/r/prez.js
Line: 236
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Node.setUserData
The Node.getUserData and Node.setUserData methods are no longer available from Web contents. Element.dataset or WeakMap can be used instead.

rename.to: www.owlfolio.org - Slide show no longer displays

title: applet method invoked during load

labels.name: browser-fixme
labels.description: This requires manual assignment for the browser name

milestone.title: invalid
milestone.description: Issues which do not make sense or are clearly not in the scope of this project.

body:
<!-- @browser: Firefox, Chrome -->

**URL**: various
**Browser**: Firefox, Chrome
**Version**: 29.0, 34.0
**Problem type**: Looks like the browser has a bug
**Site owner**: No

**Steps to Reproduce**
1) Write an applet that takes time to load (Java SDK 1.6.0_21 was used in failing scenario, I suspect the Java version used is immaterial to the problem)
2) Attempt to invoke a method of the applet from JavaScript.

Problem can be worked around by issuing a window.alert("Pause..") command from JavaScript prior to invoking the applet method. This blocks the applet method call until the applet load completes.

Applet method call works correctly once initial load has completed.

Expected Behavior: applet method invoked correctly
Actual Behavior: applet method never called

Additional problem documentation is available at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/search?a=1&asked_by=John_L&sortby=1&w=2

Please report planned fix dates and/or release versions to anonymousjune1935-fs@yahoo.com

However, the widget does not diplay in Mozilla Firefox or from android mobile devices which do not have built in flash players. It must have something to do with the .swf file but the widget developer has not been able to resolve the issue and claims it is a firefox issue. I am looking for a resolution. The HTML coding for the widget is as follows:

<object width="172" height="163"> 

<param name="movie" value="http://cdn.onlinecountdowns.com/w/_005.swf"/>
<param name="flashvars" value="eid=98619"/>
<param name="wmode" value="transparent"/>
<param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always" />
<embed src="http://cdn.onlinecountdowns.com/w/_005.swf"
type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowScriptAccess="always"
width="172" height="163"
flashvars="eid=98619" wmode="transparent"/>
</embed>
</object>

Could you please copy admin@nascarwagers.com on the response to this reported issue. Thanks

James Horne

body:
1) Navigate to: http://www.fresno.courts.ca.gov/case_info/caseInformationGuide.html . Users can only use IE9 or below to access the court case information database.
2) I advised webmaster of a fix and provided the code but no changes were made to the site to fix the browser access problem. I then created a website using the code that works.
2) for further info and fix go to http://fresnocourtinfo.com/search.html - the site I created that uses the code I gave the Fresno Superior Court webmaster.
Expected Behavior: To access the Fresno Court's database using the latest versions of all browsers.
Actual Behavior: Only using Internet Explorer versions 6 through 9 can access the database through the Court's website. For some strange reason, The test I ran using Opera allowed me access as well. Neither Chrome, Firefox, nor Safari provided access.

rename.to: www.fresno.courts.ca.gov - Access only thru IE6-9?

milestone.title: invalid
milestone.description: Issues which do not make sense or are clearly not in the scope of this project.

body:
<!-- @browser: Firefox -->

**URL**: http://offbeatr.com
**Browser**: Firefox
**Version**: 32.0
**Problem type**: Looks like the browser has a bug
**Site owner**: No

**Steps to Reproduce**
1) Navigate to: http://offbeatr.com
2) Notice that no images appear, and that the NSFW switch appears in other browsers at the top.

Expected Behavior:

A switch allowing you to show images should appear.

Actual Behavior:

No images load, and switch does not appear. A broken checkbox appears in its place.

This is because the site uses a number that Firefox tries to parse as an octal literal. 002177780. Octal literals were removed in ES5.

rename.to: offbeatr.com - NSFW switch does not work
